result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick A Shadick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rick A Shadick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rick A Shadick was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Includes domestic abuse surcharge. 
Attorney fees paid to Edmund Jelinski will be added once invoice is received and approved by the Court. 
Payments previously collected will be applied. Current payment plan will remain in place until obligations are paid in full. 
** Amended 1/12/16 to include attorney fees paid to Edmund Jelinski. Attorney fees will be included in current payment plan. **
